Text: Myrsine:  It was formerly placed in the family Myrsinaceae before this was merged into the Primulaceae.

Text: Myrsine:  It is found nearly worldwide, primarily in tropical and subtropical areas.

3:
--------------------
Text: Myrsine:  It contains about 200 species, including several notable radiations, such as the matipo of New Zealand and the kōlea of Hawaiʻ i (the New Zealand "black matipo", "Pittosporum tenuifolium", is not related to "Myrsine").
Triplets:<matipo
